question: Which Indian sportsperson has become the first bowler in women's cricket to pick 300 international wickets?
explanation: Indian pacer Jhulan Goswami has become the first bowler in women\'s cricket to pick 300 international wickets. She achieved this feet after reaching the landmark figure in India\'s 9-wicket win over Sri Lanka on September 11. Earlier,  Indian Cricketer Mithali Raj became the most capped player in the history of Women\'s ODIs cricket.
